Title: Compliance Officer (Ship Side Inspection)
RoleDescription: We are seeking a "Compliance Officer" to ensure that ship side inspections are conducted correctly and in accordance with regulatory standards, company policies, and industry best practices. The Compliance Officer will play a critical role in maintaining operational integrity, safety, and compliance with maritime regulations.  Key ResponsibilitiesInspection Oversight  Verify that ship side inspections are performed accurately and thoroughly.  Ensure compliance with international maritime regulations, safety protocols, and company policies.  Conduct audits of inspection reports and verify documentation accuracy.  Regulatory Compliance  Keep updated on relevant maritime laws, environmental regulations, and industry standards.  Ensure adherence to IMO (International Maritime Organization) guidelines, SOLAS (Safety of Life at Sea), MARPOL (Marine Pollution), API (American Petroleum Institute), EI (Energy Institute), TIC (Testing, Inspection and Certification) Council, and other applicable regulations. Recommend corrective actions and improvements to inspection procedures.  Develop and implement compliance monitoring programs to mitigate risks.  Reporting & Documentation  Maintain detailed records of inspections, compliance audits, and corrective actions.  Prepare reports for management on compliance status and findings.  Ensure proper documentation is submitted to relevant authorities when required.  Investigation & Incident Management  Conduct root cause analysis for inspection failures or non-compliance incidents.  Assist in incident reporting and recommend corrective actions to prevent recurrence.  Collaborate with **internal and external stakeholders** to resolve compliance-related disputes.  Continuous Improvement & Process Optimization  Develop and implement best practices for ship side inspections.  Identify areas for efficiency improvements in inspection procedures.  Work with operational teams to enhance inspection accuracy and effectiveness.  Technology & Digital ComplianceUtilize inspection software and digital reporting tools to streamline compliance tracking.  Ensure proper documentation and data integrity in electronic compliance systems.  Keep updated on new technologies that enhance inspection accuracy and regulatory adherence.  Work Environment  Will require on-site visits to ships and shore side for inspection verification.  Frequent travel to ports, terminals and maritime facilities.  Working at Heights is mandatory.Attending offshore operations is mandatory.Hybrid role with a mix of office-based compliance work and field inspections.  Bachelor's degree in Maritime Studies, Marine Engineering, or a related fieldMinimum 3-5 years of experience in compliance, ship inspections, or regulatory enforcementStrong knowledge of API MPMS, ISGOTT, EI, and other regulationsExperience in shipboard operations is essential  Excellent attention to detail, analytical skills, and problem-solving abilities  Strong communication and reporting skillsAbility to work independently and collaborate with inspection teams
